Dialogue:
EK: Good evening!
AO: Good evening.
EK: How was your day?
AO: I worked this afternoon and surfed the internet afterward.
EK: Internet surfing can be quite time-consuming, right?
AO: Yes. What do you usually look at online?
EK: Do you research hobbies?
AO: What are your hobbies?
EK: I like bikes, outdoor activities, and travel.
AO: Do you have friends with similar interests?
EK: They're not deep enough to be called hobbies.
AO: Did you start these recently?
EK: Yes, all of them. Last year, I got a large motorcycle license and bought a bike.
AO: A large motorcycle sounds exciting!
EK: I had no interest in motorcycles for over 30 years.
AO: Was there a specific reason for the change?
EK: No specific reason, just a whim. I decide quickly sometimes.
AO: You seem to make decisions fast.
EK: Yes, that's one of my skills. Do you have hobbies?
AO: I enjoy having a drink in the evening.
EK: I also like having a drink in the evening.
AO: What do you usually drink?
EK: I used to drink beer, but now I prefer whiskey.
AO: Whiskey can be complex to appreciate.
EK: That's true. I haven't had the courage to order it at a bar yet.
AO: Bars can be intimidating.
EK: I'm thinking of trying it soon.
AO: Check prices first, then decide.
EK: If I ask, they will help, right?
AO: Yes, they will. Let me know how it goes. Take care.

EK: Hello!
DK: Hello.
EK: Are you off today?
DK: Yes, doing laundry and relaxing.
EK: Sounds like a pleasant weekend. Do you go anywhere on your days off?
DK: Not much due to COVID-19.
EK: I see. I tend to go out more often.
DK: Where do you usually go?
EK: I enjoy casual shopping.
DK: I visit electronics stores and home centers, typically on weekdays.
EK: I also love browsing electronics stores, even if I don't need anything specific.
DK: Discovering new items is enjoyable.
EK: Have you bought any new electronic appliances recently?
DK: Yes, an LED light last year.
EK: We switched ours recently too. It's much brighter.
DK: No special setup needed, remote-controlled, and uses less power.
EK: Convenient indeed, but choosing the right one can be overwhelming.
DK: Checking various electronics stores helps.
EK: Even charging cables come in many varieties.
DK: Many options, even at 100 yen shops.
EK: I visited a 100 yen shop recently and was surprised by the changes.
DK: Items priced at 200 yen or 300 yen are more common now.
EK: It used to feel like things were worth less, but now it's the opposite.
DK: Online info makes cost-effective products popular.
EK: That really has a significant impact.
DK: Articles and videos on 100-yen shop items are popular.
EK: I often refer to YouTube when buying something.
DK: I also check reviews if interested in a product.
EK: It's important to use functional products for a long time.
DK: Good products get repeat purchases. Thank you.

EK: Hello!
DQ: Hello!
EK: Did you go anywhere this summer?
DQ: Yes, I visited my parents' house and a nearby river.
EK: That sounds nice! Do you swim in it?
DQ: The children did, but the water was quite cold.
EK: Rivers can be chilly. Is it a mountain stream?
DQ: No, it's a slow-moving river.
EK: It sounds pleasant. Was the water clean?
DQ: Yes, it was. I brought my dog and had a drink by the river.
EK: That's wonderful! What breed is your dog?
DQ: I have two shepherds, a German and a Belgian.
EK: They must be big!
DQ: Yes, one is 33kg and the other is 23kg.
EK: That sounds like fun.
DQ: Definitely. They look rough but are really cute.
EK: I adore dogs! I've always wanted one.
DQ: Do you have a favorite breed?
EK: I love Shiba Inus. They are adorable!
DQ: Mameshibas are also very cute!
EK: True, but I'm often away from home.
DQ: That might be tough for a pet.
EK: Yes, starting is easy, but maintaining is hard.
DQ: I understand. I haven’t gone out much either, except for shopping.
EK: That’s relatable. Having large dogs must make your home lively!
DQ: It does! Plus, we have a cat too.
EK: Like a little pet kingdom!
DQ: The kids love them; it's like pet therapy.
EK: Just being at home with pets makes me happy.
DQ: Yes, it's a great way to unwind.

EK: Hello!  
DQ: Hello!  
EK: Any new interests lately?  
DQ: Reading in my free time.  
EK: What books do you read?  
DQ: Light novels and swordsmen stories.  
EK: Do your kids read too? I read novels sometimes.  
DQ: What authors do you like?  
EK: Keigo Higashino is a favorite.  
DQ: I like his work too.  
EK: Once I start a book, I finish it fast.  
DQ: Same here.  
EK: I used to struggle with reading but now find it interesting.  
DQ: It's engaging. I borrowed the latest Kaga series from the library.  
EK: Sounds good. Any recommendations?  
DQ: "The Guardian of the Camphor Tree".  
EK: Haven't read it.  
DQ: It's less known but good for kids.  
EK: The title sounds interesting.  
DQ: It's fantastical and relevant to modern issues.  
EK: I'll buy it next time I'm at the bookstore.  
DQ: Libraries work too.  
EK: I like having physical books on my shelf.  
DQ: My daughter likes that too, but we lack space.  
EK: Too many books can be an issue. Thoughts on e-books?  
DQ: My family uses them, but I can't recall the brand.  
EK: E-books are convenient, but I prefer paper.  
DQ: I prefer paper too.  
EK: Turning pages and the smell are part of the experience.  
DQ: Agreed! Phones are popular with kids, but paper is still best.

EK: Hello!  
DQ: Hello!  
EK: Do you drink alcohol?  
DQ: Yes, I enjoy beer.  
EK: You enjoy beer too! I've noticed more people choosing non-alcoholic options lately.  
DQ: Yes, non-alcoholic drinks have become popular.  
EK: Some are surprisingly good, don't you think?  
DQ: I've tried, but I still prefer traditional beer.  
EK: I usually stick with regular drinks if I'm not having alcohol.  
DQ: Lemon-flavored sparkling water is more appealing to me.  
EK: Agreed. What’s your favorite brand of beer?  
DQ: I like Premium Malts and Ebisu.  
EK: We have similar tastes!  
DQ: If I’m drinking beer, I want a good one.  
EK: Exactly! I try different beers, but always come back to those.  
DQ: The atmosphere makes draft beer enjoyable.  
EK: Absolutely. More places are offering craft beer now.  
DQ: True, though it can be pricey and not always worth it.  
EK: Yes, it's a gamble with unknown brands.  
DQ: Belgian or dark beers are generally good.  
EK: I'd love to visit Belgium and try their beers.  
DQ: That sounds nice. I’d like to try white beer.  
EK: Yeast beer, right? It probably tastes better there.  
DQ: Is it really better at room temperature?  
EK: Not sure, but I prefer it chilled.  
DQ: A chilled glass makes it better.  
EK: I lived in Germany once; it was great for beer.  
DQ: I spent 4 weeks in Germany and loved the beer.  
EK: It was a fantastic place to enjoy beer!  
DQ: Looking forward to tonight. Thanks for the chat!

EK: Good evening!
BO: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
EK: Have you been engaged in any new hobbies recently?
BO: Yes, I have started fishing.
EK: Do you fish in the sea or elsewhere?
BO: I fish in rivers.
EK: Do you use lures or live bait?
BO: Both. Sometimes I use insects.
EK: Have you attempted fly fishing?
BO: No, I have not tried it.
EK: Is fly fishing particularly challenging?
BO: Yes, it is more difficult.
EK: Is river fishing suitable for beginners?
BO: Yes, it is good for beginners. Do you have any hobbies?
EK: I’ve recently become interested in camping.
BO: Camping is enjoyable.
EK: Have you gone camping lately?
BO: Not lately, but I used to camp frequently.
EK: I recently purchased a tent and am prepared to start.
BO: Lake Kawaguchi is a recommended camping location.
EK: Camping by the lake sounds perfect.
BO: You can also fish there.
EK: There are many excellent camping spots to choose from.
BO: Solo camping is currently popular.
EK: Solo camping seems like a good option.
BO: Setting up a tent alone can be tricky.
EK: Modern tents are very easy to set up.
BO: That is helpful information.
EK: It took me less than five minutes to set it up indoors.
BO: That’s impressive. Have a great camping trip!
